intro: Astragalus cicadae var. laccoliticus, commonly known as the cicada milkvetch, is a rare flowering plant native to specific regions of China. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its distinctive yellow flowers and compound leaves. The plant is known for its unique seed pods and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. Due to its limited distribution and ecological significance, it is considered a species of conservation concern.
